intro: Heterotheca rudis, commonly known as the roughleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, rough-textured leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent central disk. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Heterotheca rudis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
